page.title: 08Houses in Chapel Street.
page.content: In Chapel Street there are several examples of houses and cottages built during the Victorian era.The{Manse}was bought by the Congregational Church when it was sold by auction in 1879.It is red brick and has a slate roof. During the second half of the 19th century the development of rail transport led to the widespread use of Welsh slate for all types of buildings. It was much sought after as a substitute for inflammable thatch. {Eversley,}the former Chapel House was originally a small residence known as Vine Cottage, probably late Georgian or Regency. In 1899 Mr. A. Bowtell enlarged and converted the cottage to its present style with bay windows at the front. An interesting feature is the tile hanging on one wall. When clay tiles became cheap and easily available they were often used thus.
